content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    lc_str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    stripped = strip(lc_str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    cleaned = replace(stripped, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return cleaned
end
```

This function takes a string `col` representing the column name and returns a new string with the same content but lowercased, stripped of whitespaces, and with spaces and hyphens replaced by underscores.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my-column")
"my_column"
```

The function is generic and can be used for any `AbstractString`, which makes it compatible with a wide range of Julia data structures that store strings.
